title: Incubus Studio Albums
description: The American rock band from Calabasas, California. To date, they have sold over 13 million albums worldwide, with over 8 million in the United States alone. This Quest is in order by album release date.

questEntries.title: Fungus Amongus
questEntries.description: The debut studio album, released on Stopuglynailfungus Music On Chillum, Incubus' own independent label.

questEntries.title: S.C.I.E.N.C.E.
questEntries.description: The album has been certified Gold by the RIAA. It has been mentioned by various band members that the acronym S.C.I.E.N.C.E. stands for Sailing Catamarans Is Every Nautical Captain's Ecstasy.

questEntries.title: Make Yourself
questEntries.description: The album has been certified double platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) and produced three charting singles—'Pardon Me', 'Stellar', and 'Drive'—all of which reached the top three of the Billboard Alternative Songs chart.

questEntries.title: Morning View
questEntries.description: With the album producing the popular singles 'Wish You Were Here' and 'Nice to Know You', Morning View generally achieved critical praise and went double-platinum, making it the band's highest selling album.

questEntries.title: A Crow Left of the Murder...
questEntries.description: The music of A Crow Left of the Murder... incorporates elements of art rock, alternative metal, jazz, pop and progressive rock. The work of guitarist Mike Einziger takes equal prominence in focus to that of vocalist Brandon Boyd, in contrast to previous albums which focused more prominently on Boyd's vocalization.

questEntries.title: Light Grenades
questEntries.description: For the most part, Light Grenades expands upon the sounds previously explored in 2004's A Crow Left of the Murder....

questEntries.title: If Not Now, When?
questEntries.description: Preceded by the singles, 'Adolescents' and 'Promises, Promises', the album represented the band's longest gap between studio albums at the time, and their final full-length release through long-time label Epic Records.
The album was previously produced by Dave Sardy, and later re-produced and mixed by Skrillex, a close friend of the band. The album's first single, 'Nimble Bastard', peaked at number 4.
